blow up.translation[0].definitions[0].de: to destroy something, or to be destroyed, by an explosion
blow up.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: The plane blew up in midair.
Rebels attempted to blow up the bridge.
blow up.translation[0].definitions[1].de: to fill something with air or gas
blow up.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: Can you blow up this balloon?
blow up.translation[0].definitions[2].de: if a situation, argument etc blows up, it suddenly becomes important or dangerous
blow up.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: A crisis had blown up over the peace talks.
blow up.translation[0].definitions[3].de: if you blow up a photograph, you make it larger
blow up.translation[0].definitions[4].de: to become very angry with someone
blow up.translation[0].definitions[4].ex: Jenny’s father blew up when she didn’t come home last night.
I was surprised at the way he blew up at Hardy.
blow up.translation[0].definitions[5].de: if bad weather blows up, it suddenly arrives
blow up.translation[0].definitions[5].ex: It looks as if there’s a storm blowing up.
blow up.translation[0].definitions[6].de: if something you have done or planned to do blows up in your face, it suddenly goes wrong
blow up.translation[0].definitions[6].ex: One of his deals had just blown up in his face.
blow up.translation[1].definitions[0].de: a photograph, or part of a photograph, that has been made larger
blow up.translation[1].definitions[1].de: a sudden big argument or disagreement
